alert.note: Alert for Jo Daviess (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 9:24PM CST until December 24 at 6:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Northwest winds could gust as high as 50 mph by Friday. Blizzard conditions will also be possible, along with extremely cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 to 40 below zero will be possible, especially starting Thursday afternoon. * WHERE...In Iowa, Keokuk, Washington and Jefferson Counties. In Illinois, Jo Daviess County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, leading to power outages. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Impacts from the combined effects of the wind and snow are expected. Thus, blizzard conditions will be possible, even after the falling snow has stopped. This will be a long duration event, so plan appropriately prior to the start. Plan holiday travel around peak hours of the storm, either before or after impacts. If confidence increases, the Winter Storm Warning may eventually be upgraded to a Blizzard Warning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
